entries.text: No rest for the wicked, nor staleness for the modernists. The 2014 edition of chromatic's 'Modern Perl' is out.
entries.title: Modern Perl: 2014 Edition is Out

entries.author: yuki_kimoto
entries.text: A new version of GitPrep is out, announces Yuki Kimoto, and it had some nice features and, as the screenshots shows, looks darn good.
entries.title: GitPrep 1.6 is released - Time zone support, Charset support, and improvement of markdown

entries.author: toby_inkster
entries.text: What's up in the extended world of Moose in March? Nothing major, but a lot of little things. Toby Inkster has the details, and the links.
entries.title: Planet Moose - March 2014

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Gabor Szabo reminds us that Perl can explain itself in more details, if we ask nicely.
entries.title: use diagnostics; or use splain

entries.text: Don't already know the Perl debugger? Shame on you... But today's your lucky day: Chisel presents here a primer on this fundamental tool.
entries.title: Learning the Perl debugger: Lesson 1

entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: David Farrell gives us here a curated list of the interesting new modules that  appeared on CPAN in March. Lots of nifty treasures in there.
entries.title: What's new on CPAN - March 2014

entries.text: Debugging is often a foray on the very brim of the cliffs of  sanity. Lech Baczynksi tells us of his adventures when he had to lean over and peek at the chasm below...
entries.title: Solved mystery - perl on XAMPP won't run modified scripts "End of script output before headers"

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: When answering a question on Stack Overflow, one can link  to Perl modules in a way that will break once the module gets updated in the future (which makes us all sad), or in a way that will let all future generations enjoy the bestest and latest version of the module forever. Gabor shows us the difference.
entries.title: Fixing CPAN links on Stack Overflow

entries.text: minicpan is a wonderful tool to have your own local copy of CPAN's latest releases. fishy shows how he uses it to always have his CPAN on a thumbdrive with him.
entries.title: Carrying (mini)CPAN

entries.author: reini_urban
entries.text: "To each his own" folk wisdom tells us. Reini Urban would beg to differ, and warn us of the pitfalls of the 'each' iterator.
entries.title: Do not use each

entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: Security can be hard. But sometimes, it can be as easy as adding a wee little line to your HTTP header. David Farrell demonstrates.
entries.title: Perl web application security - HTTP headers

entries.text: Programming in Perl, but missing Python's decorators? Fear not, Piotr Roszatycki has something for you!
entries.title: Python's decorators in Perl

entries.text: When writing web services, asynchronous programming is almost certainly bound to come into the picture. Usually, it's nicely abstracted by a web framework. But, as dakkar shows here, rolling your own is not as painful as one would think.
entries.title: Asynchronous web services with PSGI and IO::Async

entries.author: timm_murray
entries.text: From the Wumpus Cave, Timm Murray walks us to the crypt(),  and then through the various better encryption solutions out there.
entries.title: Perl Encryption Primer: Passwords

entries.author: curtis_ovid_poe
entries.text: DBIx::Class's resultset classes are often slim, logic-less affairs. But Ovid shows us here how  they can also be used to create a much smarter interaction with the database.
entries.title: Custom DBIx::Class ResultSets

entries.author: breno_de_oliveira
entries.text: Want to get your Dancer application running on a Media Temple's grid service? You're in luck: garu has a walk-through for you.
entries.title: The Onion Stand: Perl Dancer on Media Temple (gs)

entries.title: Perl-related events

header: This week is exceptionally good for the beginners amongst us. Not only the new edition of Modern Perl is out, but we also have quite a few tutorials. Not that the more experience reader won't have their fill; new version of GitHub-like GitPrep being released, Moose article aggregation, survey of the new modules for March... there should be enough to keep everybody happy. Enjoy! ~ `/anick
subject: Modern Perl Now Moderner
